alert.note: Alert for Fairfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 11:30PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...River and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Connecticut, including the following county, Fairfield. * WHEN...Until 415 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows remain elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1130 PM EST, At 11:15 PM EST, Gauge reports from the Still River at Brookfield indicated minor flooding. The stage of this river is expected to remain above its flood stage through at least 4:00 AM EST. Water levels should recede below flood stage late in the overnight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Danbury, Ridgefield, Bethel, Brookfield and New Fairfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
